data.title: ClearMotion
data.meta_description: ClearMotion is a proactive ride system that transforms the foundation of cars- ride and handling. It does for motion what noise cancelling does for noise.
data.text:
Kevin Woodward is the VP of Sales overseeing our OEM and Tier 1 customer relationships. He leads the team that distills the voice of the customer and the market to drive our product needs. Kevin has over 15 years of experience in the automotive chassis space leading global teams, building relationships in the value stream and growing business.

Lorna Mayer is the VP of HR / Finance at ClearMotion. At Joost she worked closely with the Skype co-founders to grow the company from 12 to 250 employees over 4 locations in 18 months, bringing internet streaming television from an idea to reality. She has a history of implementing and refining policies/procedures to ensure efficiency, compliance, and scalability. She has earned a reputation for aligning ideas, people and technology in the pursuit of ambitious goals.

Michael leads ClearMotion’s Global Business Operations (Purchasing, Quality and Supply Chain) teams having more than 22 years of OEM experience.

Before joining ClearMotion, Michael headed up the Purchasing department for JLR’s Joint venture in China, with responsibility of managing the business’ ¥7.2bn RMB annual spend. He was able to reduce the business’s material cost base by 4.6%, generating year on year savings of over ¥231m RMB per annum.

Abhi Rangineni is the director of systems, software engineering and vehicle integration. He is also responsible for Functional Safety and Cyber Security of the Fully Active Suspension system. Abhi has over 20 years experience in the automotive industry where he led multiple EPS systems release for ZF, introduced world’s first active seatbelt system and released pedestrian protection system on Jaguar vehicles. Abhi has been a keynote speaker at automotive chassis and software conferences.

Joe Belter serves as director of the full active actuator team and is responsible for delivering the hardware into production. He has been a key engineer within ClearMotion, responsible for many of the enabling innovations since the early days of ClearMotion.

Joe comes from a background in research and development of high bandwidth actuators for robotic applications.
